title: Topical agents or dressings for pain in venous leg ulcers.
endpoint_carrier_snippet: Both trials reported that the between-group diﬀerence in pain relief assessment scores was statistically significant.

title: Dual stimuli-responsive polyurethane-based hydrogels as smart drug delivery carriers for the advanced treatment of chronic skin wounds.
endpoint_carrier_snippet: "Ibuprofen (IBU - Sigma Aldrich, Italy), selected as anti-inflammatory and analgesic model drug... released IBU quantification was carried out using a High Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC)..."

title: Path sampling with memory reduction and replica exchange to reach long permeation timescales.
where_endpoint: Methodology section, specifically on the permeability derivation from RETIS
endpoint_carrier_where: Page 4, paragraph discussing ibuprofen's permeation pathway.
endpoint_carrier_snippet: The polar group creates metastable states in ibuprofen’s permeation pathway, which can cause the trajectories to be trapped, making it an excellent application of memory reduction to keep the trajectory lengths short.

title: Diffusivity of α-, β-, γ-cyclodextrin and the inclusion complex of β-cyclodextrin: Ibuprofen in aqueous solutions; A molecular dynamics simulation study.
endpoint_carrier_snippet: self-diffusion coeﬃcients reported in this work are calculated as the average of four independent simulations starting from different initial conﬁgurations.
notes: No specific mention of a diffusion cell or Franz cells; focus on molecular dynamics simulation of ibuprofen and β-cyclodextrin.

title: Morphological and genetic activation of microglia after diffuse traumatic brain injury in the rat.
endpoint_carrier_where: Results section, paragraph describing gene expression data
endpoint_carrier_snippet: CD45 gene expression showed a significant 17 fold increase at 7 days post-injury compared to uninjured sham.
formulation_carrier_where: Methods section, paragraph detailing ibuprofen dosage and administration schedule
formulation_carrier_snippet: At 30 minutes post-FPI, uninjured and brain-injured animals were treated with an initial dose of vehicle (saline) or ibuprofen (20 mg/kg, i.p.) and then daily for 7 days.
notes: The study predominantly discusses the effect of ibuprofen in the context of microglial activation post-TBI but does not explicitly use a diffusion cell setup or describe a Franz cell experiment.
